title: Understanding Ethical Responsibility in Technology-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and experience with digital technology use
context.additional_context: A short-term intensive course for learners preparing for careers in healthcare, law, or technology, conducted in a mobile learning environment utilizing personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three ethical dilemma cases that may arise in the instructional design process.
Learners can construct a framework to analyze the ethical impacts of technology-based educational tools by applying critical design methodologies.
Learners can write a portfolio (up to 500 characters) proposing ethical responsibility implementation plans by analyzing actual instructional design cases.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
